alert.note: Alert for Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Northern and Interior Seward Peninsula; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 18 at 2:30PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water Levels Through Tuesday... Water levels on rivers and streams have risen sharply on the Seward Peninsula and in the western Brooks Range, as the remnants of typhoon Merbok tracked northeastward through the Bering Strait and Chukchi Sea. Between 1 to 3 inches of rain have fallen so far with an additional 1 to 2 inches possible through Monday night in the Kigluaik and Bendeleben Mountains and peaks of the western Brooks Range. Rivers and streams in this region may reach bankfull levels through Tuesday. This includes smaller creeks and streams including tributaries of the Noatak, Kobuk, Kivalina, Wulik, Snake and Niukluk Rivers.
